qas.question: Which Late Middle Age English kings kept their own troupes of professional actors?
Who performed the seasonal Christmas plays?
In what year did Henry VIII establish an Office of Revels?
What did Henry VIII build in 1545 for the benefit of the theatrical arts?
In what part of a nobleman's house were plays performed?
Which Early Middle Age English kings kept their own troupes of professional actors?
Who performed the seasonal non-Christmas plays?
In what year did Henry VII establish an Office of Revels?
What did Henry VIII build in 1554 for the benefit of the theatrical arts?
In what part of a nobleman's house weren't plays performed?

context: At the end of the Late Middle Ages, professional actors began to appear in England and Europe. <a0_0><b5_0>Richard III and Henry VII<b5_0/><a0_0/> both maintained small companies of professional actors. Their plays were performed in <a4_0><b9_0>the Great Hall<b9_0/><a4_0/> of a nobleman's residence, often with a raised platform at one end for the audience and a "screen" at the other for the actors. Also important were <a1_0><b6_0>Mummers<b6_0/><a1_0/>' plays, performed during the Christmas season, and court masques. These masques were especially popular during the reign of Henry VIII who had a <a3_0><b8_0>House of Revels<b8_0/><a3_0/> built and an Office of Revels established in <a2_0><b7_0>1545<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
